reviews.title: Nightmare
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 week nightmare in the Riu Bachata, we become ill on only the second day (Friday 16th) of our holiday. As both of us were ill we ended up bed ridden for two days with nothing but water which didn’t stay inside for very long. On the Monday we managed to drag ourselves to see the Thomson rep, who took our details along with that of other guests who were ill and we were advised to go to the doctors where we encountered a 3 hour wait! At this point we realised this wasn’t just the usual stomach upset but something more serious due to the sheer volume of people in the surgery with the same symptoms. The doctor informed us that we had a form of gastroenteritis and extremely dehydrated. We were given two types of tablets, one being antibiotics and sent directly back to our room to await a visit from the nurse whereby we both received an intravenous drip and were given numerous injections. The nurse seemed all too familiar with this situation, as soon as she entered the room she removed the lampshades of the bedside lamps so she had somewhere to suspend the drip from. Thomson claimed that it was a flu effecting the hotel and were extremley reluctant to take matters seriously therefore it took guests demanding further information before they arranged a meeting (which was not made public so not all guests were aware) to discuss the problem at hand. Since returning to the UK we have seen our own doctor who agrees with the findings from the Dominican doctor and we are awaiting results from further tests.

Wow, by reading all the previous reviews from early June, I'm glad I waited until the "virus" took a vacation somewhere else! I was so impressed by the staff at every bathroom exit and restaurant entry with their anti-bacterial gels...now I know why. But, it's still a good idea regardless!
reviews.title: Best Service you can get anywhere

reviews.text: None of us got sick, except for one (minor), and we were a party of 11! We enjoyed the food and thought that the variety was adequate. Also, the rooms were nothing out of the world, but adequate and very clean.

reviews.text: The most impressive thing about this resort is the service provided by the staff at every location. Sure, you may have to tip them a couple of bucks, but so what?! You know what a dollar means to these people and for us...a candy bar?
reviews.title: Loved it! Fantastic

reviews.text: The special attention we received at dinner was great, we were seated at the veranda with a beautifully decorated table with fresh flowers and candles each evening, and since we were a large party, it guaranteed that we would sit all together. Also, one day we mentioned that we wanted to eat "tonstones" (green fried plantains), and the chef came out from the kitchen and personally went into town and bought green plantains for us, cooked them and had them ready for only our table that evening!

reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from the Dominican Republic. (We are 28/29 years old) We had booked this hotel for two weeks and as you can imagine were very concerned about the reviews that we had read. We were very, very dissapointed with the resort.

Don't get me wrong, the rooms are nice, very clean and the maid visits every day however if you want tacky entertainment and only local drinks (no champagne or fizzy wine shall we say) and if you want to lose weight on holiday this is the place to be. The food is cooked with LOTS of oil, and I mean LOTS. When we went to breakfast my omelete was drippng in fat on my plate! This totally put me off eating and believe me thats really unusual. The large dining area is like a school canteen and beacause they cook the food in the same room the air smells of fat.
reviews.title: Piece of mind!
Holiday Nightmare
reviews.text: After two days we had had enough. Having to put hospital style lotion on our hands every time we entered the restaurant was like being in hospital. We go on holiday to enjoy ourselves, have nice drinks and good meals but we couldnt enjoy ourselves here. I went to the thomson rep who was very nice. She told me this hotel is meant to be the second best place on the island to eat!!!!!!!! I had to find out where the first was!! For an extra £290 each we could move to the Iberostar Costa Dorada...£290 each!!! We thought that was ridiculous but now you might understand we had to pay it!!!! So after only two days of our holiday we left .....As for the Iberostar it was outstanding...well worth the extra money....Food amazing (3 speciality restaurants) food cooked fresh and using very little oil. Variety of food amazing. Entertainment team were superb and we loved it so much we would definately go back in the future.

reviews.title: fantastic holiday but be careful
reviews.text: I am currently staying in the Riu Bachata with my husband and two daughters and we are having a wonderful time! I wanted to let all future travellers know what a beautiful hotel this is. After reading some of the negative reviews this hotel has had I felt the need to reassure people that the hotel and complex is excellent. We always chose a Riu hotel because of the standard and the Riu Bachata is of no exception. The staff are always smiling, the food choice and quality is out of this world and having two daughters to keep entertained the activities staff do a great job! Having read the comments about sickness, not one of us has been ill. We enjoy all the hotel has to offer and they really could do no more with regards to hygiene and cleanliness!! The hotels have a real friendly feel and we have made lots of friends with other families who, like us are having a great time, with no sickness! So much so we are planning on re-booking for the same time next year. We leave on Monday and are really not looking forward it. I think the main problem I will have is trying to find something to wear to accomodate the extra pounds I have put on!!!
Simply, a top class hotel, A1 staff, magnificent food....a BIG recommendation from our family!
reviews.title: try at your own risk

reviews.text: Overall our stay was OK but we were quite disappointed with the hotel as we were expecting a 4 Star Plus facility as advertised by Thomson in their brochures but I am afraid that comparing this with other 4 Star and 4 Star Plus hotels we have stayed at in the Dominican Republic, (this was our 8th visit in 7 years,) I can only rate it as a 3.5 star hotel and my wife thinks that is generous.
reviews.title: if you like spain you will like this hotel

reviews.text: Our initial impression was good as I had arranged prior to our arrival for the hotel to order some flowers for me and to arrange for a sea view room as my wife and I were celebrating our 22nd wedding anniversary. The flowers and room were great except that the air con did not work in the room very well, which we reported hoping that it would get quickly fixed as we arrived at the end of a heat wave even by Dominican standards. (Unfortunately this never did get fixed properly but to the hotels credit after we complained via the Thomson rep (Vicky) because it still was not fixed after 8 nights, they did move us to another room and for our inconvenience upgraded us to a nice Junior Suite with a sea view for free (normally $102 USD a night extra but \i would not say it was worth that much extra as the standard rooms are good just not so big!!!).
reviews.title: Good holiday - But wouldn't return

reviews.text: The main beach at the front of the Bachata is sandy but as soon as you get to the waters edge you are treading on pieces of rock and then you encounter rocks within 5 metres of entering the sea and yes there are sea urchins in them so be careful or wear shoes in the water. If you walk along to the RIU Merengue next door the rocks are minimal so no problem but don’t expect to be walking on sand in the sea at the Bachata beach front. One plus point of the rocks though is that if you like snorkelling there is a great selection of fish to see around the rocks and I had some really great underwater film and photos of them. The small beach at the side of the hotel where the motorized sports go from is sandy but there are no sun beds there so not suitable really for lying out unless you like lying in the sand but it is quiet except for the odd time when a jet ski goes out or one of the nearby shop owners come along to get you to visit their shop.
reviews.title: Once u go to Bachata u dont go anywhere else!

reviews.text: Why do I not rate the hotel 4.5 star (or 5 star according to Dominican Rating)? Well a few reasons really:
reviews.title: A really good holiday.
Holiday Disaster.
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in the Bachata from 3oth. June until 14th July, It is now 18th July and my husband is still in hospital in Scotland, we had to go to hospital straight from airport as he was so unwell. The Hotel looks very clean on the surface but there is obviosly some thing very wrong. He had diahoea for 4 days in our first week which after a visit to the doctor cleared up. But on the second week 2 days before we came home he came down with a fever and had to be put on a drip and given antibiotics this was followed by vomiting, doctor gave him various pills to take along with a bill for $375. He was very unwell on flight home and was admitted straight into hospital with a urine infection ( doctor in resort put gastroenteritis on insurance document and didn't even bother to check if there waqs anything else. )He is currently waiting on a scan. Thomson rep gave us a letter on arrival informing us that hotel had been closed the week before we arrived. At welcome meeting nothing was mentioned about illness. I informed them of his illness but they didn't even keep in contact in resort to see how he was. I had to go to them. Staff in Hotel were brilliant , very friendly and helpful and it all looked lovely but there must be a hygiene problem which must be sorted out or people are going to keep getting sick. I will be in touch with Thompsons to find out why they are still sending hoildaymakers there when they know there is a problem.
My girlfreind and I went on the 30th of june for 2 weeks and it was excellent.
reviews.title: Hotel excellent Thomson rubbish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe me and my boyfriend were soo excited that we didn't notice or find anything wrong but we LOVED it!! We are both 21 years old and it was my boyfriends first trip and it was my one of many, and it was by far the best. When we first got the airport many workers were there to help us get onto the right bus. We were told that the ride was going to be long but it went by so quick. Our bus ran out of gas... but we didn't' see this as a bad thing because we got to get off the bus and go outside to view the ocean and meet new people. A new bus came shortly to pick us up and we were back on the road in 20 mins. When we got to the resort we were greeted with cocktails and friendly people. We had to wait about 30mins for our room to be ready but that didn't matter because we were to excited to go to the room because we wanted to scope out the resort. I'm pretty sure our mouths were open the whole time we were walking around. Everything was green and colorful, very well kept. We got our keys and went to our room where are mouths stayed open because the room was huge and we didn't even have a jr suit... it was just a regular room. Our view was of the tennis court which was cool so we can see when it was empty to go play and everything was SOOOO CLEAN! I hadn't slept for months before the trip for some reason but when we got there I slept every night like a baby! I'm always cold so i slept with and extra blanket but my boyfriend had the air conditioner on which made the room very cold and comfortable. If we had any questions we would call downstairs and they would have not problem helping us. We bought a calling card for $20 which gave us contact to Canada for our week stay. The first day we just ate, looked around some more and watched the entertainment which made us laugh soooo hard. I do not know how they have so much energy. They dance so fast and they get the crowd going. The next morning was orientation where you find out info about excursions and fun facts. As soon as that was done we went to book a bunch of trips. OCEAN WORLD is a must go. That was definitely the highlight of our trip. Dancing, feeding, and taking pictures with dolphins, playing and kissing sea lions, snorkeling in a huge coral tank, being in a bird cage with at least 20 on you. Just an amazing adventure. We also went to paradise island which is breath taking and full day of fun and relaxation. Snorkeling is at both of those excursions. We heard a lot of bad reviews about the locals coming in on the weekends but we didn't notice any and planned out excursions on the weekend so that we wouldn't have to be around the resort incase it was as bad as people made it out to be. But when we were back for dinner we didn't notice any difference. On the third day my boyfriend got a bad sun rash which had nothing to do with the resort but just to let you know that the doctors on the resort are amazing. We went in and in 20min they took out insurance info and gave him IV and he was fine for the rest of the trip. While laying on the beach we were approached by a worker to go on some other excursions. We both wanted to go horseback riding so we bargained with the guy and went for $25 each which was cheap for a 4hr ride and later they took us to hold snakes and tarantulas and there was a little souvenirs shop there too. Food was really good. I was scared of getting sick but we ate everything and we were fine. We were there for valentines day and my boyfriend paid $20 and when we got to our room after dinner there was a huge arrangement of flowers and rose pedals on the floor and bed and balloons on our door and inside the room. It was so cute and i loved it. No one else had it so we felt special. If you make friends with the works they go far out of their way to help you out and make your trip more than amazing. As for cleaning the room... we had no problems with this missing and everything was cleaned nicely and our fridge was always full of drinking water and beer and pops. I don't know how anyone can have a bad time here because it was the best trip o have ever been on and the people there are amazing and uplifting. I can't wait till the day i go back. I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone....
reviews.title: couldn't ask for a better trip to paradise!!

reviews.text: I just returned from the dominican republic and stayed at the riu bachata 4 days and 3 nights and I will not return. The hotel wasn't horrible but there are better hotels to chose from. The food was good, nothing spectacular but it was ok, the AC in the rooms was horrible and if not for the fan you would really spend a bad night, customer service was ok, could have been a little better, the beach was not enjoyable, it was full of seaweeds and rocks. Bottom line, if you're going to the dominican republic, go to punta cana, the crowds are better and the best resorts in the country and there. This hotel had a horrible selection of alcoholic beverages, it didn't even offer domestic beverages, the beer wasn't good and the rum and vodka were watered down, you will not get a good value at this hotel, please look elsewhere.
reviews.title: look elsewhere

reviews.text: This was my first time visiting Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic. This resort was beautiful, rooms were very comfortable and cozy. Night life great and the food awesome and for the price u can't go wrong. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Visited this hotel 13-27 June 2009.This is the first opportunity I have had to warn people off travelling here, as I am only just well enough!!!!! Took unwell at the resort and ended up in hospital on my return!!!!!! I will start at the beginning..... The views from the bus from the airport were amazing....guys on motorbikes carrying machine guns, drivers drinking from open bottles of beer! Then it got better, on exiting the bus we were met by an american woman informing us she had had her room broken into and all of her money taken! YES, it got worse.....the rooms were far from 5*, they were basic, damp smell, aircon was non existent, mould on bath tiles (lovely, I hear you say!) the so called 2 double beds were small and hard, the pillows were so flat we used towels to boost them up. I had to ask the cleaner to change our beds after a week!. Also if you have booked, ensure you hide your toiletries every day, as this is the cleaning products used by the cleaner! In fact hide anything that can be moved as the cleaner believes if it is left lying on in the room, ITS HERS! this includes money. Okay,now the food, if you like banana, you are fine...they use it in everything.....it is the same food repeated daily and both the italian and steak restuarant gave us all upset tummies!!! The entertainment for kids is easy to describe...THERE IS NONE!!!! The rest of the entertainment isn't much better. Oh, this is the best bit.....Friday-Monday they give free holidays to local residents, at first you think its sweet...thats until they are taking your inflatables, jumping on your head in the pool and you are not getting served at the food or drink bars because the staff give them as a priority...bet your glad you spent so much on your holiday now!!!! All I can say as no matter how many reviews are good.....can you take the chance!!!!!! PS. every two week you are asked to review staff, this is an interesting day.....the staff do everything but kiss your bum.....cause if they don't get named as being good...THEY GET SACKED THE FOLLOWING DAY!!!!
reviews.title: 'PLEASE DON'T GO!!!'

reviews.text: Stayed at RIU Bachata 7/31 thru 8/7/09. Had two ocean view rooms, one for my husband and myself and one for our 17 year-old son. The rooms were okay in design...the beds were very hard/firm and the pillows were like laying your head on a sandbag. The "air conditioning" was next to non-existent, unless you count the ceiling fan as the air conditioning. I had read other reviews of a musty odor/smell in the rooms, but neither of our rooms had a smell or odor (thank goodness!). The grounds of the resort were kept immaculate throughout our stay. The beach was wonderful. The Dominicans are very kind people...you hardly pass one without them looking directly at you and saying "hola". The food was okay, but it was the same thing day after day after day. I was tired of the food by the 3rd day. Can't imagine what people who stay there two weeks at a time do! We thought we'd try something different one evening and tried to have dinner at the restaurant at the RIU Merengue, but they wouldn't let us in....said we were supposed to be at Bachata. We were under the impression we could use the restaurants and amenities of all three resorts, but apparently not? I was very adamant about not drinking the faucet water, washing my hands frequently, and using the hand sanitizer, but I still got some sort of stomach bug. Purchased some Immodium from the "Farmacia" (10 pills for $15) and took those. It would have been nice to have the fridge re-stocked daily. They supposedly re-stock the fridge every other day, but it wasn't even that often. Also thought internet should have been included in the price. Not only do you have to pay $8/hour for it, but the only place it is available is in the lobby. All in all, our stay was okay, but my husband and I both agreed we would not go back there again.
reviews.title: Okay place....but not spectacular.
